definition: to be weary of/to be fed up with/tedious

sentences.english: Life creates itself in delirium and is undone in ennui.
sentences.chinese: 生命自創於狂亂，破滅於厭倦中。

sentences.english: I'm tired of being cooped up in this office.
sentences.chinese: 我厭倦了被關在這辦公室裏。

sentences.english: A lot of people are saying, "Enough of this kind of effete culture.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都在說，“我們已經厭倦了這毫無生氣的文化。

sentences.english: We are tired of the globalist network of power.
sentences.chinese: 我們厭倦了全球化的權錢網絡。

sentences.english: What if I'm tired of playing YMCAs or the Boys and Girls Clubs? I want to step into the elite competition.
sentences.chinese: 如果我厭倦了與小孩子的比賽，我會參加精英賽的。

sentences.english: CM: Gaia is tired of expecting as well.
Some had not yet wearied of their gentle boat-like padding.
sentences.chinese: 有的還未厭倦那船一樣的徐徐的划行。

sentences.english: I noticed, behind the neutrality of his gaze, a deep weariness.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到他不露聲色的注視背後藏着深深的厭倦。

sentences.english: Taurus could tire of Pisces's emotional instability, and Pisces may in turn feel that Taurus is insensitive to their needs.
sentences.chinese: 牛會厭倦魚情緒的不定，魚會以爲牛不再關注它所需。

sentences.english: I'm fed up with this dank weather; it's time we had some sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我對這種陰溼天氣極其厭倦，該出出太陽了。

sentences.english: Tired of all the same-old fashion games of table & ball?
sentences.chinese: 厭倦了使用舊的方式來玩雙旋轉球嗎？

sentences.english: God grows weary of kingdoms, but never of little flowers.
sentences.chinese: 上帝漸漸厭倦了大王國，卻從來不曾厭惡小花朵。

sentences.english: They want to be constantly stimulated mentally， yet they get bored quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望不斷地得到精神刺激，但是很快又會厭倦。

sentences.english: The handstand group gives up the contest because of the training fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 倒立組卻因爲厭倦而放棄比賽。
用賞心樂事來彌補厭倦。

sentences.english: But soon the Wicked Lady grew bored with forest life.
sentences.chinese: 但是壞女人很快就厭倦了森林裏的生活。

definition: bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to fall in love with/to be in love with
